table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:2px; cell-spacing:2px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:1px; border-spacing:2px; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:raised-color; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: The Stream package is used to simulate streams in a model. The flow in a stream is routed instantaneously to downstream streams

li.link: Prudic, D.E., 1989, Documentation of a computer program to simulate stream-aquifer relations using a modular, finite-difference, ground-water flow model: U.S. Geological Survey Open-File Report 88-729, 113 p.

li.text: Stream reaches within segments are listed from downstream to upstream instead of from upstream to downstream.
Linkages between streams are not specified.
Linkages between streams are specified incorrectly.
Compared with the Stream (STR) package, the
provides greater flexibility in how streams are specified but the parameters in it can not be used with the Sensitivity or Parameter-Estimation processes.
Prior to MODFLOW-2005 version 1.11, the Stream package did not support the "FREE" option of the Basic Package, so input was required to be entered in fixed-field format where indicated.

text.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: In MODFLOW-2005 version 1.11 and later, variables are free format if the option “FREE” is specified in the Basic Package input file; otherwise, most variables are read with the indicated fixed format.
The Stream (STR) package was originally called the "Streamflow-Routing" package. This name is identical with the name of the
package. The name "Stream" rather than "Streamflow-Routing" is adopted here for the STR package to minimize confusion.

para.text: Input to the modified version of the Stream (STR) Package is read from the file that has file type "STR" in the MODFLOW
file. Optional variables are shown in brackets. All variables are read with fixed format except as noted.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:2px; cell-spacing:2px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:1px; border-spacing:2px; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:raised-color; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Item 0 is optional -- “#” must be in column 1. Item 0 can be repeated multiple times.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Text - is a character variable (199 characters) that starts in column 2. Any characters can be included in Text. The “#” character must be in column 1. Except for the name file, lines beginning with # are restricted to the first lines of the file. Text is printed when the file is read.
This optional record is read with free format; it must start with the word “

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: NPSTR - is the number of stream parameters that will be defined.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: MXL - is the maximum number of stream reaches that will be defined using parameters. MXL must equal or exceed the sum of
MXACTS NSS NTRIB NDIV ICALC CONST ISTCB1 ISTCB2 Option
I10 I10 I10 I10 I10 F10.0 I10 I10 Free

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: MXACTS - is the maximum number of stream reaches that will be in use during any stress period. MXACTS includes reaches that are defined using parameters as well as reaches that are defined without using parameters.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: NSS - is the number of stream segments.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: NTRIB - is the number of stream tributaries that can connect to one segment. The program is currently dimensioned so that NTRIB cannot exceed 10.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: NDIV - is a flag, which when positive, specifies that diversions from segments are to be simulated.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: ICALC - is a flag, which when positive, specifies that stream stages in reaches are to be calculated.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: CONST - is a constant value used in calculating stream stage in reaches. It is specified whenever ICALC is greater than 0. This constant is 1.486 for flow units of cubic feet per second and 1.0 for units of cubic meters per second. The constant must be multiplied by 86,400 when using time units of days in the simulation. See also

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: ISTCB1 - is a flag and a unit number for the option to write seepage between the stream reaches and model cells into the list file or an unformatted (binary) file.

li.text: If ISTCB1>0, it is the unit number to which seepage between each stream reach and the corresponding model cell will be saved whenever the variable
If ISTCB1=0, seepage between each stream reach and the corresponding model cell will not be written into any file.
If ISTCB1<0, streamflow for each reach and seepage between each stream reach and the corresponding models cell will be written into the LIST file whenever the variable

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: ISTCB2 - is a flag and a unit number for the option to store streamflow out of each reach in an unformatted (binary) file.

li.text: If ISTCB2 > 0, it is the unit number to which streamflow in each stream reach will be saved whenever the variable
If ISTCB2 ≤0, streamflow in each stream reach will not be stored in a disk file.

para.text: Option—is an optional list of character values. (MODFLOW-2005 and MODFLOW-NWT only)

li.text: abc”—defines an auxiliary variable, named "abc", which will be read for each stream reach as part of Items 4 and 6. Up to 20 variables can be specified, each of which must be preceded by "
." These variables will not be used by the Groundwater Flow Process, but they will be available for use by other processes. The auxiliary variable values will be read after the Stop variable.

para.text: Repeat Items 3 and 4 for each of NPSTR parameters.
Item 3 is read with free format. If PARNAM is to be a time-varying parameter, the keyword “
” and a value for NUMINST must be entered.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: PARNAM – is the name of a parameter. This name can consist of 1 to 10 characters and is not case sensitive. That is, any combination of the same characters with different case will be equivalent. All parameter names must be unique.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: PARTYP - is the type of parameter to be defined. For the STR Package, the only allowed parameter type is STR, which defines values of streambed conductance.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: NLST - is the number of stream reaches that are included in each instance defined for the parameter.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: INSTANCES – is an optional keyword that designates a parameter as time varying. The keyword is case-insensitive; that is, it may be entered in any combination of upper- and lower-case letters. If INSTANCES is present, it must be followed by a value for NUMINST. If INSTANCES is absent, PARNAM is non-time-varying and NUMINST should not be present.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: NUMINST – is the number of instances that are included in the definition of a time-varying parameter, where each instance is a list of stream reaches and associated properties. If the keyword
is present, NUMINST must be present. If the keyword
is absent, NUMINST should not be present.
repetitions of Item 4 (parts a and b) are read. After each repetition of Item 4a, NLST repetitions of Item 4b are read.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: INSTNAM – is the name of an instance associated with the parameter PARNAM specified in the corresponding Item 3. The name can consist of 1 to 10 characters and is not case sensitive. That is, any combination of the same characters with different case will be equivalent. Names entered for INSTNAM must be unique for any given parameter, but names may be reused for instances associated with different parameters.
[Layer Row Col Seg Reach Flow Stage Condfact Sbot Stop] [xyz]
NLST repetitions of Item 4b are required. The
repetitions of Item 4b follow each repetition of Item 4a when

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Condfact - is the factor used to calculate streambed hydraulic conductance from the parameter value. The conductance is the product of Condfact and the parameter value.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: ITMP - is a flag and a counter. Its meaning depends on whether or not stream parameters are being used.

li.text: >0), ITMP is the number of stream parameters being used in the current stress period. No streams will be used in the current stress period if ITMP ≤ 0.
=0), ITMP is the number of stream reaches for which data will be read in the current stress period. If ITMP < 0, STR data from the preceding stress period will be reused.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: IRDFLG - is a flag, which when positive, suppresses printing of the stream input data for a stress period. The input data are printed if IRDFLG is 0 and

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: IPTFLG - is a flag, which when positive, suppresses printing of stream results for a stress period. Results are printed if IPTFLG is 0,
[Note that either Item 6 or Item 7 may be read, but not both.]
Layer Row Col Seg Reach Flow Stage Cond Sbot Stop [xyz]
<0, Item 6 records are used from the previous stress period.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Cond - is the streambed hydraulic conductance.
>0. Free format is used. Iname is read if Pname is a time-varying parameter.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Pname - is the name of a parameter that is being used in the current stress period.
parameter names will be read. They must be specified in an order that meets the downstream ordering requirements for Seg and Reach.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Iname – is an instance name that is read only if Pname is a time-varying parameter. Multiple instances of the same time-varying parameter are not allowed in a stress period.
> 0, in which case Item 8 is repeated for every stream reach. The records must be is the same order as the stream reaches.

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Width - is the width of the stream channel. It is read only when stream stage is calculated (

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Slope - is the slope of the stream channel. It is read only when stream stage is calculated (

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Rough - is Manning’s roughness coefficient. It is read only when stream stage is calculated (
> 0, in which case Item 9 is repeated
times in sequential order of the segments. Each record contains

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Itrib - contains the segment number for each tributary that flows into a segment.
values are read for each segment. Unused values of Itrib should be set to 0. Itrib records are read only when
>0, in which case Item 10 is repeated
times in sequential order of the segments.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Iupseg - is the number of the upstream segment from which water is diverted. If the segment is not a diversion, Iupseg should be specified as 0. Iupseg records are read only when
